intro: Peltophyllum caudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed water lettuce, is a floating aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features a rosette of broad, fleshy, waxy leaves that are typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant has a distinctive long, thin stalk that extends from the center, giving it its common name. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Peltophyllum caudatum is often used in water gardens and ponds for its ornamental value and ability to help control algae growth.
